newsitem.title: UK: Med gas oil ends up, cargoes cap high sulphur pric.
newsitem.headline: Med gas oil ends up, cargoes cap high sulphur pric.

text.p: Mediterranean oil products were mostly firmer on Tuesday, traders said.
Gas oil prices were firmer with the $1-2 rise in prices drawing some fresh buying interest.
Low sulphur material continued well supported by buying from Italy, Spain and France although, despite fairly thin avails. Outright trade was thin with buyers and sellers standing $1-2 apart.
Diesel cargoes valued around $2 firmer at $164 a tonne cif Med with 0.2 sulphur cargoes assessed around $159 CIF Med.

A high sulphur fuel oil cargo was reported sold by a French refiner to an Italian refiner at high cif quote plus $3 on Monday but some traders said the market was a bit on the softer side with several cargoes still on offer in the Med.
"It is still slightly weaker with several cargoes not finding homes yet," one trader said.
